note.p: Education: Colfe's School, London (1859-1864); Royal College of Chemistry, Oxford Street, London. PhD

Career: Worked in Leipzig; taught chemistry at St Bartholomew's Hospital; Professor of Chemistry, London Institution (1871); Assistant Examiner in Chemistry at the University of London; President, British Association (1885); cremated at Golder's Green
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1939-1941 vol 3 pp 229-245, plate, by F W Keeble
References: Sir Brian Pippard, FRS, 'Schoolmaster-Fellows and the campaign for science education' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 63-81, plate
Joan Mason, 'Hertha Ayrton (1854-1923) and the Admission of Women to the Royal Society of London' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 201-220
R A Baker and R A Bayliss, 'Louis Compton Miall, FRS: Scientist and Educator, 1842-1921' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 201-234
Lawrence Badash, 'British and American Views of the German Menace in World War I' in NR 1979-80 vol 34 pp 91-121
Notes: Defaulter on 1882 PL; re-admitted the following year.
